definition[0]: one of two children born at the same time to the same mother
example[0]: The twins are now eight months old.
definition[1]: used to describe one of two children who are twins
definition[2]: used to describe two things that happen at the same time and are related to each other
example[2]: the twin problems of poverty and unemployment
definition[3]: to form a relationship between two similar towns in different countries in order to encourage visits between them
example[3]: Chichester in England is twinned with Chartres in France.
definition[4]: to form a relationship between two places, people, or ideas
example[4]: Dole has been twinned in the history books with his old rival Bush.
